blurb.B1: Return to either Orson or Gladys for your reward.
blurb.B3: ask why he didn't turn in this contraband.
blurb.B4: You can Intimidate or Persuade (45) him to get him to buy the weapon for 100 Bit Cartridge,
blurb.B5: but you'll lose Auntie Cleo Reputation (5% negative).

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, hello. Why do you seem familiar? Have we met?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Yeah. You asked me to grab your prototype schematics from storage.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Your memory cannot be that bad.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: No. Who are you again?

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ah! Yes! Very good. And have you done that?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Got them right here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Not yet.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: What a relief. You hold months of work in your hands.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Hold on. FORCE weapons are contraband. Why didn't you turn this in when you found it?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: [Hand over the FORCE schematics]

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Anton would have just given them to Porter without a second thought. What a waste of potential that would have been.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: And what's your secrecy worth, I wonder?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: These are valuable schematics. I could sell them for quite the profit.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Maybe they'd have let you experiment. You could've saved a few lives.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: He's your boss--that's his decision to make, not yours.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: ...I see. A proper shakedown. I might've known not to trust a common thug.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: So be it. I'll buy them off of you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Hand over the schematics.> Deal.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Actually, I already have a buyer for these, so I'm just going to keep them.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Much obliged. Here are your bits. Now, let's see here... attach this, twist that, apply a little pressure, and...

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Voila! I can finally call this little side project complete. Thank the Law.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh. Hm. I can't be caught with this. You take it. If R&D buys the schematics from me... perhaps I'll get you the first model, hot off the presses! I'll, uh... call you? Yes. I'll call you.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: I might've guessed. Such are the risks when hiring mercenaries. Very well, I've got no ability to stop you.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Without those schematics, I'll never be able to repair this pistol. What am I going to do with this useless hunk of junk?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Not my problem. I think we're done here.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Very well. It has most certainly not been a pleasure.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now leave, and see that I am never again insulted by your presence.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hmm. Sadly true--contraband does tend to fetch a high price among the colony's ne'er-do-wells.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: All the more reason I need to keep my discretion... discreet.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now, if you wouldn't mind returning them to me...

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Perhaps so. However, so as not to dwell on the past, I'll thank you to keep this between us.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now. I'll just attach this here, bit of glue, a little--elbow--grease...

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm just quite selective about what information I choose to retain. That said--yes, I recognize you. Have you retrieved my schematics yet?

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: I am Orson Shaw, chief behavioral--wait. Yes, I'm quite sure we've met. My apologies. Have you retrieved my schematics yet?
